info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 12:58AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Granite and southeastern Powell Counties through 130 AM MDT... At 1257 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Philipsburg, or 16 miles west of Deer Lodge, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Garrison, Princeton, Brock Creek, Goldcreek and Avon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 166 and 181. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
